title: feat: Support fp_poly kicad_mod directive
description: Adds support for the fp_poly directive in KiCad module files, enabling conversion of polygon shapes on copper, silkscreen, and fabrication layers into appropriate circuit elements.
body:
This change introduces support for the fp_poly directive in KiCad module files.                                                 

The implementation handles polygons on various layers:                                                                                          

 • Copper layers (.Cu): Rectangular polygons are converted to filled pcb_smtpad elements. Non-rectangular polygons are converted to pcb_trace   
   elements.                                                                                                                                    
 • Silkscreen layers (.SilkS): Converted to pcb_silkscreen_path.                                                                                
 • Fabrication layers (.Fab): Converted to pcb_fabrication_note_path.                                                                           

New tests have been added to verify the conversion of polygons on both silkscreen and copper layers, including a case where a polygon trace connects two pads.

/claim #133
/closes #133

title: Fix tooltip positioning when 3d-viewer is embedded in external sites
description: Fixes tooltip positioning calculations to ensure tooltips are displayed correctly when the 3D viewer is embedded in containers with different positioning contexts.
body:
Cause
The [Html.tsx](cci:7://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/3d-viewer/src/react-three/Html.tsx:0:0-0:0) component was using page-level absolute positioning (`rect.left + x, rect.top + y`) for tooltips, which fails when the viewer is embedded in containers with different positioning contexts.

## Changes Made
### [src/react-three/Html.tsx](cci:7://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/3d-viewer/src/react-three/Html.tsx:0:0-0:0)
- **Fixed positioning calculations**: Changed from page-level coordinates to container-relative positioning by removing `rect.left` and `rect.top` offsets
- **Added container positioning**: Ensured the renderer's parent node has `position: relative` to properly contain absolutely positioned tooltips  
- **Added explicit z-index**: Set `zIndex: "1000"` to ensure tooltips appear above other content


## Testing
yalced the 3d-viewer to tscircuit.com repo for testing 
Before with latest 3d-viewer version 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e71fb659-85d2-49ca-9c52-8237973dbb1d



After the fix

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7ee32367-d5af-4f0a-a2c5-bf8be2ed7123


Ref #466

title: feat: Support importing GLTF files with binary assets
description: Adds support for importing .gltf files that reference external binary (.bin) or image assets, enabling inlining of these assets as data URIs within the GLTF structure.
body:
This PR introduces support for importing `.gltf` files that have dependencies on external binary (`.bin`) or image assets.                                                                                            
                                                                                                 
1.  **File Resolution**: The `resolveFilePath` utility now recognizes the `.gltf` file extension.                 
2.  **Asset Inlining**: When a `.gltf` file is imported within the web worker:                                                       
    - The JSON file is parsed.                                                                                                       
    - It iterates through `buffers` and `images` to find any relative URIs.                                                          
    - For each relative URI, it resolves the path, reads the corresponding file from the `fsMap`, and converts its content into a    
`data:` URI (base64).                                                                                                                
    - This `data:` URI replaces the original relative URI in the GLTF JSON structure.                                                
3.  **Blob URL Creation**: A new `Blob` is created from the modified GLTF JSON, and a `blob:` URL is generated to represent the      
final, self-contained asset. This URL is returned as the default export of the imported module.                                      
                                                                                                               
A new integration test (`tests/features/import-gltf-file.test.tsx`) has been added to validate this feature. The test ensures that a `.gltf` file referencing an external `.bin` file is correctly processed and that the final `blob:` URL contains the inlined binary   
data as a `data:` URI.

title: fix(eval): Implement recursive NPM dependency resolution
description: Fixes the issue where NPM packages with their own dependencies were not being resolved correctly by implementing recursive loading of transitive dependencies.
body:
This PR fixes an issue where NPM packages with their own dependencies (transitive dependencies) were not being resolved correctly.    
                                                                                                                                            
**Recursive NPM Imports:** The `importNpmPackage` and `importEvalPath` functions were updated to parse fetched NPM package code, find `import` statements, and recursively load those dependencies.                                                                                                    
**Robust Regex:** The import-parsing regex in `getImportsFromCode` was made more flexible to handle minified code where whitespace is removed.
